metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0642 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.5.48 and earlier, 5.6.29 and earlier, and 5.7.11 and earlier allows local users to affect integrity and availability via vectors related to Federated.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0642` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadbd18 - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-client - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-client-10.0 - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-client-core-10.0 - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-common - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-connect-engine-10.0 - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-oqgraph-engine-10.0 - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-server - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-server-10.0 - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-server-core-10.0 - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-test - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-test-10.0 - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-test-data-10.0 - 10.0.23-1
No subscription required

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-client - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-common - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-server - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.12-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

percona-xtradb-cluster-server - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
percona-xtradb-cluster-server-5.6 - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
percona-xtradb-cluster-source-5.6 - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.0 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.0.23-1').
mysql-5.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.12-0ubuntu1').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
